page.title: 06Wellington College
page.content: {Wellington College}was founded in {1859.}The first{Duke of Wellington} died on the 14th September,1852, and { {Queen Victoria }planned to set up a school to educate the orphans of army officers. The money was raised by public subscription and the site was chosen as there was an abundance of land, building materials, the adjacent railway and a good water supply. {Wellington College}opened its doors to 76 pupils on the{20th January and 9 days later{Queen Victoria}opened it officially. The commemoration plaque says{"On the 29th January our {visitor Her Majesty Queen Victoria {opened the College as the national {monument to the Great Duke of {Wellington".}The College has several articles once owned by the Duke and they are now in a showcase.
